posters.label: United Nations
posters.title: The Global Goals official website
posters.text: World leaders agreed to 17 goals for a better world by 2030. We are proud to have created the website for the agenda, with millions of visitors from all over the world.

img.alt: Three stacked screenshots from The Global Goals website

posters.label: Maktsalongen
posters.title: Lifeâ€™s a handful?
posters.text: Young women who are burning out is a growing problem in Sweden. We created a text based coach to help them to be able say no and handle stress in their everyday life. We, unfortunately, had over five thousands signups after only two days.

posters.label: Quantified Planet
posters.title: Healthier cities with real-time data
posters.text: The idea works, but can be hard to explain. We created a logotype, brand and an award-winning website that explain something complex in an inspiring way.

posters.label: Amnesty International
posters.title: Troll factory for the good guys
posters.text: We helped Amnesty release thousands of friendly bots on Twitter to fight for an network free of online harassment. An unusual project for sure.

posters.label: Planet 15
posters.title: Level up! Your planet is flourishing
posters.text: Planet 15 is a fun and immersive mobile game that inspires citizens to explore nearby local nature, while helping scientists collect environmental data. Launching 2019.

img.alt: Rendering of a planet created in the Planet 15 game

posters.label: Hempur
posters.title: Sustainable toilet paper
posters.text: Things we learn as consultants: Bamboo is not a tree but grass, it's silky soft and has an extreamly low carbon footprint. The fantastic team at Hempur just started their journey, and brought these brand online.

img.alt: A product shot of the Hempur six-pack toilet paper
